body_html:
Hi all,
Have any one considered implementing the Scaled Conjugate Gradient Algorithm (SCG) in Tensorflow?
SCG avoids the line search alltogether. SCG is currently implemented in Mathlab as 'trainscg' method.
I would like to contribute, but I am, however, currently not that familiar with Tensorflow.
For reference see:

  • A scaled conjugate gradient algorithm for fast supervised learning, M. F. Moller, Neural Networks 6 (4), 525-533, 1993.
    and more general info on:
  • Efficient Training of Feed-Forward Neural Networks

The Hessian times a vector (used in the SCG) can be calculated exact and/or approximated.

A scaled conjugate gradient algorithm for fast supervised learning.pdf

Efficient training of feed-forward neural networks - moller - phd thesis.pdf

Hi all, 
Have any one considered implementing the Scaled Conjugate Gradient Algorithm (SCG) in Tensorflow?
SCG avoids the line search alltogether. SCG is currently implemented in Mathlab as 'trainscg' method. 
I would like to contribute, but I am, however, currently not that familiar with Tensorflow. 
For reference see: 
- A scaled conjugate gradient algorithm for fast supervised learning, M. F. Moller, Neural Networks 6 (4), 525-533, 1993.
 and more general info on: 
- Efficient Training of Feed-Forward Neural Networks

The Hessian times a vector (used in the SCG) can be calculated exact and/or approximated. 
--
